intro: Boehmeria crenata, commonly known as Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant species native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Boehmeria crenata is sometimes cultivated for its fiber, which has been used in traditional textiles.
